qas.question: What is the translation or meaning of a griot?
Aside from music what other activity plays a significant role in culture?
What type of garment or accessory is traditionally worn at some of the dances held?
What is the name of the musician that was a part of the roots and was also a blues guitarist?
What is a well known Afro-pop artist?
What translates to keeper of the songs?
What plays a minor role in culture compared to music?
What is not common among friends?
Where are modern mask dances performed?

context: Malian musical traditions are derived from the <b5_0>griots,<b5_0/> who are known as "<a0_0>Keepers of Memories<a0_0/>". Malian music is diverse and has several different genres. Some famous Malian influences in music are kora virtuoso musician Toumani Diabaté, the late roots and blues guitarist <a3_0>Ali Farka Touré<a3_0/>, the Tuareg band Tinariwen, and several Afro-pop artists such as <a4_0>Salif Keita<a4_0/>, the duo Amadou et Mariam, Oumou Sangare, and Habib Koité. <a1_0><b6_0>Dance<b6_0/><a1_0/> also plays a large role in Malian culture. <b7_0>Dance parties<b7_0/> are common events among friends, and traditional <a2_0>mask<a2_0/> dances are performed at <b8_0>ceremonial events.
